context: Does the middle mouse button (scroll wheel) depress easily? That's the one thing I didn't like about my MX518, it felt mushy at times.
response: It's easy to press, but it's also nice and firm. You won't be accidentally pressing it down unless you have a finger made of lead; it also has a nice, muffled click when you press it down. By far my favorite mouse wheel.

context: Can you hook up two of the controllers for co-op games like contra?
response: Absolutely, I do this all the time.  You just have to set up player 1 and 2 for each side...button wise.  Sometimes changing the usb ports jacks up the settings but most of the time, they just work.

context: I am a beginner at guitar and recently bought this game. Does anyone know if there is a tutorial section on finger posturing?
response: There is a whole section of tutorials in the software.  Everything from the most basics, like how to put the strap on, hold the pick, where to strum, to many advanced techniques.  All the lessons have practice pieces as well.

context: do you need a kinect to use any of the remotes funtions?
response: No, a Kinect is not required to use this remote with the Xbox One. However, you would need to buy an IR cable for the Xbox One in order to use it to control your TV (turning the volume up or down, or turning it off) or your cable box, because the Xbox One can't independently control infrared-controlled devices.
